  • Method Details

    • setContext

      void setContext(NameDefinitions defs)
      Set a shadow context for this target

      When doing optional unboxing with the ? operator, the expression is evaluated in the containing context (i.e., outside the ``). This can lead to confusion in situations where local variables are defined. For instance, `For x In xs: List x?` seems valid, but x will be evaluated outside the For and not have access to the x that it defines. To produce a better error message, we provide a second set of variables to x? that it exist but can't access; if it finds one of these variables, it can explain the situation better than the confusing “x is undefined”.

      Parameters:
      defs - the variables accessible from the context inside the back ticks
